name: Ollie
instructions: Start rolling at a comfortable speed with your back foot on the tail and front foot near the middle of the board. Pop the tail down sharply while jumping upward, sliding your front foot up the board to level it out in the air. Keep your shoulders square with your board and look ahead. Land with both feet over the bolts and bend your knees to absorb impact.

name: Nollie
instructions: Place your front foot on the nose and your back foot around the middle of the board. Pop the nose down while jumping upward, then drag your back foot toward the tail to level the board. Keep your weight centered so the board doesn’t drift behind you. Land with both feet over the trucks and roll away.

name: Pop Shuvit
instructions: Begin in an ollie stance. Pop the tail slightly backward and scoop it behind you with your back foot while keeping your front foot out of the way. Watch the board rotate 180 degrees beneath you. Catch it with your feet over the bolts and absorb the landing.

name: Frontside 180
instructions: Set up like an ollie and wind your shoulders slightly opposite the direction of the spin. Pop and turn your shoulders frontside, letting your hips and board follow. Keep your feet above the board so it stays with you in the air. Land rolling switch with your knees bent.

name: Backside 180
instructions: Ride at a steady speed with your shoulders relaxed. Pop an ollie and look over your back shoulder, allowing your torso to lead the backside rotation. Keep the board under you by staying centered over your toes. Land in switch and ride away smoothly.

name: Kickflip
instructions: Set up for an ollie with your front foot slightly angled and closer to the bolts. Pop the tail, then slide your front foot up and flick it off the heel-side edge of the nose to start the flip. Keep your legs slightly separated to let the board rotate under you. Catch the board with your front foot first, then back foot, and land with knees bent.

name: Heelflip
instructions: Place your front foot slightly forward and more centered than for a kickflip, with toes pointing slightly toward the nose. Pop the tail and slide your front foot up, snapping your heel off the toe-side edge to start the flip. Keep your body upright to stay over the board. Catch the board after a full rotation and roll away.

name: Varial Kickflip
instructions: Combine a pop shuvit and a kickflip. Scoop the board with your back foot to start the shuvit while flicking your front foot for the flip at the same time. Stay centered so the board doesn’t shoot forward. Catch the board when it comes back under you and land over the trucks.

name: 360 Flip
instructions: Use a strong scoop with your back foot to start a 360 shuvit while your front foot flicks the board like a kickflip. Jump straight up to give the board room to spin and flip beneath you. Spot the grip tape as it comes back around and stomp down with both feet. Keep your shoulders square to stay balanced on landing.

name: Hardflip
instructions: Set up like a frontside shuvit with your front foot slightly pointed forward. Pop and scoop the board frontside while your front foot flicks downward and slightly across the nose to start the flip. Stay compact so the board can flip through your legs. Catch it and land centered.

name: Manual
instructions: Ride at a medium speed and gently shift your weight to your back foot to lift the front wheels. Keep your core tight and arms out for balance. Look ahead instead of down at your board. Hold the manual as long as possible and set the front wheels down smoothly.

name: Nose Manual
instructions: Place more weight over the front trucks while rolling and slightly lift the back wheels. Keep your hips over the front foot and use your arms to counterbalance. Stay relaxed in the knees to absorb small bumps. Drop the back wheels when you’re ready to exit.

name: Boardslide Frontside
instructions: Approach the rail or ledge at a slight angle. Ollie so that the board lands perpendicular on the obstacle with the middle of the deck sliding. Keep your shoulders facing forward and the weight centered so the board doesn’t slip out. At the end, pop or lift the front truck to return to riding stance.

name: Boardslide Backside
instructions: Approach the obstacle with it behind your heels. Ollie and turn your hips backside so the middle of the board lands on top of the rail. Keep your shoulders aligned with the slide and look toward the end of the obstacle. Pop or pivot off the end and roll away.

name: 50-50 Grind
instructions: Approach the ledge or rail straight on or at a small angle. Ollie up so that both trucks land on the obstacle evenly. Keep your weight centered over the board and your shoulders parallel to the obstacle. Slightly lift your nose at the end and roll off clean.

name: 5-0 Grind
instructions: Get into the grind like a 50-50 but shift your weight to the back truck once you lock in. Keep the nose slightly raised and your shoulders parallel to the ledge. Use small ankle and knee adjustments to stay balanced. Drop the front truck at the end and ride away.

name: Nosegrind
instructions: Approach with a bit more speed than for a 50-50. Ollie up and push your weight forward so only the front truck locks onto the ledge. Keep your back foot light and your core engaged to hold the grind. Nollie or small hop off the end to exit.

name: Smith Grind
instructions: Ollie onto the rail like a 50-50, but let the back truck lock over the rail while the front truck dips down on the far side. Keep your back knee slightly bent and weight over the back truck. Use your shoulders to stay in line with the obstacle. Lift the nose to exit smoothly.

name: Feeble Grind
instructions: Approach backside, ollie onto the rail, and aim the back truck to lock on top while the front truck dips to the far side of the rail. Keep your shoulders aligned with the rail and your weight mostly over the back foot. Stay light on the front to avoid hanging up. Lift off the end to roll away.

name: Nose Slide
instructions: Approach the ledge at a small angle. Ollie and turn 90 degrees so that the nose of your board lands on the ledge. Keep your weight over the front foot and the board slightly pressed into the obstacle so it doesn’t slip. Pivot or pop off the end and ride away.

name: Tail Slide
instructions: Roll toward the ledge at a shallow angle. Ollie and rotate 90 degrees so your tail lands on the ledge. Keep pressure on the back foot to stay locked in while your front foot guides the slide. Pop or pivot off the end to exit.

name: Melon Grab
instructions: On a quarter pipe or off a kicker, pop up and bring the board toward you. Reach your lead hand to the heel edge between the trucks to grab the board. Keep your knees tucked and your eyes on the landing. Let go, straighten the board, and land with bent knees.

name: Indy Air
instructions: Ride up a transition with enough speed to get out of the coping. As you rise, lift your knees and grab the toe edge between your feet with your back hand. Keep your front hand free for balance and look back toward the ramp. Release and absorb the landing.

name: Nose Pick
instructions: Ride up a quarter pipe and plant your nose briefly on the coping while keeping your back foot on the tail. Use your front foot to stabilize the nose and your back foot to pop back in. Keep your weight over the board so it doesn’t shoot out. Roll away clean.

name: Rock to Fakie
instructions: Ride up the ramp and let your front truck go over the coping while the board rocks on the middle. Shift your weight slightly forward, then lean back and lift the front wheels to let them drop back in. Stay centered to avoid sliding out. Ride away fakie down the transition.

name: Axle Stall
instructions: Approach the coping with moderate speed. Turn 90 degrees and land both trucks on the coping with your weight centered. Pause briefly, then turn back in by lifting the front wheels and leaning into the ramp. Bend your knees to ride away smoothly.

name: Frontside Smith Grind
instructions: Approach frontside and ollie onto the rail, landing the back truck on top while the front truck dips to the near side. Keep your shoulders facing forward and your weight over the back foot. Use small ankle movements to keep the board tracking straight. Lift the nose to exit.

name: Bigspin
instructions: Set up for a backside pop shuvit. Scoop the board hard with your back foot while your body turns 180 degrees frontside at the same time. Let the board do the 360 rotation beneath you and catch it as you complete your 180. Land rolling switch.

name: Frontside Flip
instructions: Combine a frontside 180 with a kickflip. Pop and start turning your shoulders frontside while your front foot flicks the board. Stay over the board so it doesn’t shoot out. Catch the flip as you complete the 180 and land facing the opposite direction.

name: Backside Flip
instructions: Pop an ollie and turn your shoulders backside while flicking the board for a kickflip. Let the board flip and spin beneath you, keeping your body rotating with it. Spot the grip tape and catch it as you finish the 180. Land with your knees bent.

name: Impossible
instructions: Set up like a 3-shuv but with your back foot more on the toe-side corner of the tail. Pop and scoop upward, wrapping the board vertically around your back foot. Keep your front foot out of the way so the board can complete the wrap. Catch it on top and land over the bolts.

name: No Comply 180
instructions: Ride at a comfortable speed and step your front foot off the board slightly in front of you. At the same time, pop the tail with your back foot and use your front foot to guide the board into a 180-degree turn. Jump back on the board as it rotates. Land with both feet and ride away.

name: Fakie Bigspin
instructions: Ride fakie and wind your shoulders. Pop a fakie shuvit while your body turns 180 frontside. Let the board do a full 360 under you and catch it as you land regular. Keep the handle—well, your shoulders—leading the trick so it stays smooth.

name: Half Cab Heelflip
instructions: Ride fakie and start a fakie frontside 180. As your shoulders open up, pop and flick a heelflip in the opposite direction of travel. Stay centered over the board so the flip doesn’t drift. Catch the board and finish the 180 to land regular.

name: Laser Flip
instructions: Combine a 360 frontside shuvit with a heelflip. Pop and scoop frontside strongly with your back foot while your front foot performs a powerful heelflip. Jump straight up to give the board room to rotate and flip. Spot the grip tape and stomp it down to land.

name: Full Cab
instructions: Ride fakie and wind your shoulders backside. Pop and turn your head and shoulders to start a fakie backside 360. Keep the board under you by staying centered and letting your hips follow the rotation. Spot your landing and roll away regular.

name: Wallride
instructions: Approach the wall at an angle with enough speed. Ollie or lift the board onto the wall while leaning slightly into it so the wheels make contact. Ride across the wall for a moment, then turn back down to the ground. Absorb the landing and keep rolling.

name: Hip Air
instructions: Approach the hip at a slight angle and ride up the transition. As you leave the lip, shift your board and shoulders toward the landing side. Keep your knees bent in the air and look toward the landing. Touch down on the new line and roll away.

name: Airwalk
instructions: Launch off a kicker or out of a quarter pipe. Grab the nose with your front hand and kick both legs forward and apart in a scissor motion. Keep the board controlled with your hand and bring your feet back to the deck before you land. Let go and absorb the impact.

name: Blunt to Fakie
instructions: Ride up the quarter pipe and place your tail on the coping with the back truck over and the front truck still in the ramp. Pause briefly in the blunt. Then pop the tail and pull the board back into the ramp, landing fakie. Keep your weight centered to avoid washing out.

name: Kickflip Backside 50-50
instructions: Approach the ledge backside and pop a kickflip aimed toward the obstacle. As the board flips, guide it so both trucks land on top of the ledge. Keep your weight centered to hold the grind. Drop off the end or pop out.

name: Noseblunt Slide
instructions: Approach the ledge at an angle, pop high, and rotate 90 degrees so your nose is over the ledge while the tail is lifted. Lock the nose and keep your weight forward to hold the slide. Stay light on the back foot. Pop or pivot off at the end and roll away.

name: Tre Manual
instructions: Perform a 360 flip and catch the board slightly nose-high. As you land, shift your weight back to get into a manual immediately. Keep your core tight and your eyes forward to hold the balance. Set the front wheels down clean to finish.

name: Fakie Nosegrind
instructions: Roll fakie toward the ledge and pop up, turning slightly so your front truck (which is actually your back truck) lands on the edge. Keep your weight over the grinding truck and your shoulders parallel to the ledge. Nollie or pivot off the end to exit. Ride away regular.

name: Smith Grind to 180 Out
instructions: Lock into a smith grind and keep your shoulders slightly open. As you near the end of the obstacle, pop off and turn your hips 180 in the direction of travel. Keep the board under you by staying centered. Land rolling the new direction.

name: Frontside 50-50 to Frontside 180 Out
instructions: Grind a normal frontside 50-50 with shoulders facing forward. At the end, pop slightly and turn your shoulders frontside while guiding the board 180 off the ledge. Keep your weight over the center so the board doesn’t shoot. Land clean and roll away switch.

name: Switch Kickflip
instructions: Ride switch and set your feet like a normal kickflip but mirrored. Pop with your switch tail and slide your front foot toward the nose, flicking off the heel-side edge. Stay centered since riding switch can make you lean. Catch the board and land switch over the bolts.

name: Bigspin Heel
instructions: Combine a backside bigspin with a heelflip. Scoop the board for the bigspin while your front foot flicks a heelflip outward. Jump high to let the board rotate and flip. Spot the grip tape and land rolling switch.
